title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of love and ambition in the roaring twenties.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A story of racial injustice and the loss of innocence in the American South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: A political allegory about the Russian Revolution and the rise of Stalinism.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel set in a future world where people are genetically engineered and conditioned to be happy.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story of teenage angst and alienation in post-World War II America.

title: The Color Purple
author: Alice Walker
description: A story of a young African American girl who faces racism and abuse in the American South.

title: The Diary of a Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
description: A diary of a young Jewish girl who hid from the Nazis during World War II.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: A story of the Joad family's migration from the Dust Bowl to California during the Great Depression.

title: The Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: A coming-of-age story of a young orphan named Pip.
